meanings.definition: A symbol at the beginning of a musical staff indicating the pitch of the notes.
meanings.sent1: The clef on the sheet music helped me know which notes to play.
meanings.sent2: The musician quickly identified the clef and started playing the melody.
meanings.sent3: The clef on the music sheet seemed to wink at me, as if saying, 'I'll guide you.'
meanings.sent4: The clef was like a beacon, leading the way through the musical score.
meanings.sent5: The bold clef stood out, making it easy to remember where to start playing.

meanings.definition: A key or guide to interpreting a map or code.
meanings.sent1: The clef on the map showed us the direction to the treasure.
meanings.sent2: Using the clef, we were able to decipher the secret code.
meanings.sent3: The clever detective followed the clef and found the hidden message.
meanings.sent4: The clef acted as a secret key, unlocking the mystery of the map.
meanings.sent5: With the clef in hand, we confidently navigated through the confusing map.

meanings.definition: A mark used in printing to indicate the beginning of a new section.
meanings.sent1: The editor placed a clef to signal the start of the next chapter.
meanings.sent2: In the book, the clef separated the introduction from the main story.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected clef in the middle of the page made the readers chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Like a signpost, the clef pointed readers towards a fresh narrative.
meanings.sent5: The clef acted as a visual cue, signaling a shift in the storyline.
